etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Jeremiah Dyke (bap. 1584, d. 1639), Church of England clergyman. Apparently from precipitant + -ly

definitions: With a rapid fall or descent; headlong; steeply, precipitously. Now chiefly figurative.
With excessive hurry, without deliberation; hastily, rashly.
With rapid movement, at great speed; suddenly, abruptly.
